issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: NN periodically unlinks lazy persist files with missing replicas from namespace

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: LAZY_PERSIST file gets deleted after NameNode restart.

comments.body:
Thank you for reporting this [~surendrasingh], good catch.

A better fix is to check is to avoid deleting until the NN is out of safe mode.
[~arpitagarwal] thanks for review and suggestion. I have attached new patch, Please review.

Thanks for the update [~surendrasingh]. We should also add a check for HA status. if isHaEnabled() then inActiveState() should be true. Sorry I should have mentioned that earlier.

Also perhaps we can update the test case to make it more predictable. e.g. stop DNs, restart just the NN, wait until we see corrupt files and check they are not deleted.

Thanks [~arpitagarwal] for review. I have one doubt, why we need to check {{isHaEnabled()}} and {{inActiveState()}} ??

{{LazyPersistFileScrubber}} started by {{startActiveServices()}} and this API start services for active namenode only. Please correct me if I am wrong.

Thanks you are right. I missed that part. +1 for the fix.

Do you want to take a shot at updating the test case?
Thanks, yes I will update the patch soon..

Attached new patch, please review.

In test case I am not using {{getCorruptReplicaBlocksCount()}} API for counting corrupt blocks because of [HDFS-8296|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDFS-8296]

\\
